string.text: Sentinel of the Monolith grouping. Better stay away from him. No details available.
Stalker from the Monolith grouping. No details available.
Stalker from the Monolith grouping. No details available.
Stalker from the Monolith grouping. No details available.
Militant from the Monolith grouping. Well equipped. No details available.
Military stalker. Well armed and highly dangerous. No details available.
Army Spetsnaz. Well equipped. No details available.
Army Spetsnaz. Well equipped. No details available.
Former digger who raids all the desolate laboratories and bunkers he and his associates come across.
One of the participants of the deadly fights in the Arena. No details available.
Experienced smuggler. Earned his fame by smuggling several hundred stuffed mutants out of the restricted area within a short period of time.
Bouncer at the bar. Or the Barkeep's bodyguard if you wish. Nothing is known about his present or his past.
Garik's twin brother. Bouncer at the bar. As close-mouthed as his brother.

Neither a saint, nor a scoundrel. The Barkeep knows his worth and is respected by all stalkers. Rumor has it he is hiding in the Zone from some dark events in his past. After an encounter with the anomaly, he started limping slightly and decided to change jobs. He set up a bar by the Duty faction, and the place gradually turned into the meeting point for all the Zone's veterans. The Barkeep has numerous connections both in the Zone and in the outside world.

Member of the Duty faction, more often off the wagon than on it. The Duty gave him his last chance for redemption by carrying out a mission. However, he was too drunk to get himself together and pull it off.

Good-natured, cheerful guy whose only problem is that he can't shoot from anything other than a hunting rifle. Hunter hasn't even tried any other guns lately. He recently got into a scrap in the Wild Territory and lost his family rifle. Now he is lounging about in the bar hoping that someone will give him his rifle back.
Mysterious know-it-all stalker. Trades information in the bar.
Commander of all punitive raids and expeditions against any horde of mutants.
The Arena owner's bodyguard. Not much is known about his past, but all of it is bad. He hates his brothers.

One of Duty's Founding Fathers, and their leading idea-monger. Responsible for formulating the faction's sacred code, he basically recruited all of Duty's key members. Second only to his good friend, General Voronin. He also leads the hunt for the Dark Stalkers, which has been foiled again and again.
Stranger affected by the Brain Scorcher.
Current leader of Duty, and the most well-known of Duty's Founding Fathers. He defected from the Ukrainian Army, along with a few others, to found Duty and fight the Zone on his own terms.
Scientist who died in an underground laboratory. Who knows what happened to him...
Another researcher who died in an underground laboratory. Terrible things happened to him...
An alkie - just like all the other Bandits.
Unknown stalker. Unsavory reputation. No details available.
Unknown stalker. Unsavory reputation. No details available.
One of the bandit leaders. Well armed and highly dangerous. No details available.

Legendary stalker rumored to have a cure for any illness, which he brews using the Zone's fauna. Tends to keep eccentric company and has a domesticated pet Pseudodog. Lives in the Great Swamps. Part of Strelok's group.
Unknown mercenary. Well armed and highly dangerous. No details available.
Unknown mercenary. Possibly well armed. No details available.
Leader of the Merc gang. Well armed and highly dangerous. No details available.
A deserter trader from the mercenaries. He is a skilled man with good connections such as the Sin faction.
eL Bandito. One of those who made it to somewhere farther than Cordon or Garbage.
Leader of the military presence in North Hills.
Just a regular Joe trying to get by in the zone.
Experienced stalker. Always keeps his eyes open.
One of the Duty breakaway group members. Still lives by Duty rules but prefers to get things done his own way.

Leader of Sin. Disillusioned and pragmatic, Veles has no qualms regarding moral dilemmas and thinks the end justifies the means. However, he keeps his misanthropy in check whether he reflects upon important matters, and he finds meaningless bloodshed distasteful.
If you don't know, don't ask!
Unknown mercenary. Well armed. Do you really need to know more?
Regular sergeant in the Ukrainian Army. No details available.
Regular private in the Ukrainian Army. No details available.
Unknown stalker. Unsavory reputation. No details available.
Long service captain of the Ukrainian Army. No details available.
Took over leadership at the rookie camp after Wolf. Full of purpose, aggressive, and has well-deserved authority over newcomers.
Decent mechanic who set up shop in the rookie village. Honorable and grateful to those who help him.
Unknown mercenary. Possibly well armed. No details available.
Smart rookie. Wolf seems to like him and often sends him on important missions.

The Man of Myths himself, revered by all for supposedly being the First Stalker of the Zone. They say he can usher you to any place in the Zone, knowing ways to bypass the Brain Scorcher. His services, however, are not for sale. Being the First Stalker, he has been through the length and breadth of the entire Exclusion Zone - including the coveted center. Said to be an associate of Strelok's group.
Regular sergeant in the Ukrainian Army. No details available.
Stalker who got his name for being nearly invisible and truly indispensable. The trader turns to him for sensitive missions such as spying on someone, snooping around and eavesdropping.
Major commanding the army outpost by the bridge. Known to take bribes from stalkers to let them pass over the bridge.
Regular private in the Ukrainian Army. No details available.
Spetsnaz. Well equipped. No details available.
Unknown mercenary. Well armed and highly dangerous. No details available.
Rookie. New to the Zone. No details available.
Hardened stalker and leader of the rookie village. Was mentored by Father Valerian and had a younger brother who was murdered. Not to be underestimated. Does not like to be called "Papa Wolf".

One of the Zone's most prominent traders. Ever since his youth, from school backyards to correctional institutes, he has had the uncanny ability to set up successful, self-sustaining markets. When the Zone emerged, he came here and created the black market of artifacts as it is known today. Even mercenaries deem him untouchable and fear his wrath.
Barman to the swift and dangerous.
One of a group of stalkers who prefer to stay out of the mainstream.
A trader from Construction Site. If you need something, he's got it or can get it. He has some memory problems which - according to himself - don't affect his trading.
Has certain authority with the bandits in the Zone. Borov's sidekick.
A stalker from the Duty faction. No details available.
Officer in the Duty faction. No details available.
Rookie. Is breaking ground in the Zone.
Hiding in the Zone from the law. Tries to maintain order in the Zone on his terms. Fights against the bandits. Cruel but fair.
Rookie. New to the Zone. No details available.
Stalker with a face as dirty as his conscience.
An experienced stalker. No details available.
Just a ghost - one of the many in the Zone.

Colleague of Sakharov and head of science at the lost factory research institute. Studies the effects of electromagnetic fields and ultrasonic frequencies on the human mind by studying the X16 lab and the Brain Scorcher psi-emissions.
Just another scientist trying to make sense of this place.
Well known and respected Stalker and brother of Wolf. Fascinated with science and the Zone.

Kolovrat is a typical nutter case. Doesn't trust anyone and relies on himself as the sole voice of reason in his personal reality. Because of his neurotic ways, he isolates himself within his shack in the little swamp. Be careful if you approach him, as he is a decent shot. There's a rumor he escaped from a mental hospital, but he probably just went insane after seeing too many horrors.
Militant from the Duty faction. Usually well equipped. No details available.
Commander of the special forces in the Duty faction. Usually well equipped.
A fighter from the Duty faction. Usually well equipped. No details available.
An incredibly talented technician, conceiving numerous gadgets such as the decoder to open the Warlabs, psi-helmets and add-on for Strelok's damaged PDA.

Former special operative and formidable gunman. Once part of the Zone Task Force, he was left for dead in an operation gone wrong and never got over it. Has a thing for knives and knows several languages. Part of Strelok's group.
A stool pigeon known across the whole Zone.
Unknown mercenary. Well armed and highly dangerous. No details available.
Unknown mercenary. Apparently new to the Zone. No details available.
Unknown mercenary. Possibly well armed. No details available.
Elite mercenary, known as leader of military base, well armed and highly dangerous. No other details available.
Sentinel of the Monolith grouping. Better stay away from him. No details available.
Stalker from the Monolith grouping. No details available.
One of the veterans. Knows the Zone like the back of his hand. Usually well equipped and highly dangerous. No details available.
Veteran stalker. Possibly well equipped. No details available.
Stalker from the Freedom faction. Barrier commander. The man who banded together a group of people willing to sacrifice their lives for the common cause.
Bodyguard working for Lukash, the leader of the Freedom faction.
The cook of the Freedom faction. A boozer and a brawler, but an excellent cook.
A mechanic renowned throughout the Zone. Can make a tank out of a tractor or so the story goes.
Commander of the Freedom faction. No details available.
Guard from the Freedom faction. A fanatic. Very well equipped and highly dangerous. No details available.
Guard from the Freedom faction. Very well equipped and highly dangerous. No details available.
Stalker from the Freedom faction. No details available.
Sniper from the Freedom faction. No details available.
Militant from the Freedom faction. Usually well equipped. No details available.
Stalker from the Freedom faction. No details available.
Infamous for his greediness and non-compliance, but they say he can get you anything.
Stalker from the Freedom faction. No details available.
Insane stalker from the Freedom faction.
Militant from the Freedom faction. Usually well equipped. No details available.
One of the few remaining controllers that are still able to communicate via speech.
One of the C-Consciousness project members.
One of the few remaining after the attack on the Rostok bar.
Leader of the guys you really don't want to meet!
Just turn around and leave, you don't want to know these guys!
Freedom, its a way of life in the zone!
Head ecologist in the Pripyat region.
Head of field measurement operations in Pripyat.
Veteran stalker. Possibly well equipped. No details available.
Pripyat military. Stay out of their way!
Stalker from the Monolith grouping. No details available.
Elite stalker from the Monolith grouping. No details available.
Leader of the Monolith grouping. No details available.
Regular stalker from the Monolith grouping. No details available.
Elite monolith sniper. Shoot to kill!
Stalker from the special forces of the Monolith grouping. No details available.
Military Lieutenant and head of operations in Pripyat.
One of the soldiers who ran out of luck.
One of the stalkers who ran out of luck.
Army Spetsnaz. Well equipped. No details available.
Regular private in the Ukrainian Army. No details available.
Military stalker. Well armed and highly dangerous. No details available.
Commander of the Duty faction. Very well equipped. No details available.
Stalker from the Monolith grouping. No details available.
Militant from the Monolith grouping. Well equipped. No details available.
Fragile old man who once worked on the secret experiments and became horribly deformed and mutated. Isn't hostile by any means.
Spetsnaz. Well equipped. No details available.
One of the veterans. Knows the Zone like the palm of his hand. Usually well equipped and highly dangerous. No details available.
Veteran stalker. Possibly well equipped. No details available.
Commander of the Freedom faction. No details available.
One of the stalkers who ran out of luck.
A researcher from the mobile lab. No details available.
Scientist, expert on anomalous phenomena. Worked in America on top secret projects. Reported missing for a while now.

Looter and a murderer. A price has been set for his head. Formerly on good terms with Duty, helped them win over their territory. Now dwells in the Wild Territory and mugs lonely stalkers with his gang.
Ph.D. in biology. Studied pathogenic mutations in animals outside the Zone. Came to the Zone to study blind dog mutations.
One of the "heroes" of the Merc gang. A veteran with bullets of all calibers in his body. A rare psychopath and sadist.
One of the first field commanders of the Mercs. The leader of the gang calling themselves "Curs". An anarchist despising all laws except the law of the jungle.
Scientist working on top secret authority. No further details available.
One of the best repairmen in the zone. Highly skilled at upgrading outdated weapons.
Resident Duty leader in the Rostok factory and its surrounds.
Regular sergeant in the Ukrainian Army. No details available.
Regular private in the Ukrainian Army. No details available.
Rookie. New to the Zone. No details available.
Stalker from the Monolith grouping. No details available.
Stalker from the Monolith's special group "Crystal", responsible for the safety of the Monolith itself.
A psychomaterial form created by the Monolith.
Unknown stalker. Unsavory reputation. No details available.
Unknown stalker. Unsavory reputation. No details available.

Came to the Zone looking for adventure. Imitates the characters from popular comics of the 60s. Uses different names: Badman, Macho, the Black Coat, Banderos. Even though he has survived in the Zone for two whole years, no one really takes him seriously and it constantly drives him mad.

Fierce, wicked, crude, selfish, cruel, insensitive, cold. Nobody knows when and how he got to the Zone. Everyone fears him and he has no friends. He simply lives in the Zone, with no future and no past. After one of his numerous forays into the Zone, he lost his memory, forgetting nearly everything. He doesn't remember where he comes from, doesn't remember his real name, suffers from frequent lapses of memory. Known to completely forget his new acquaintance within an hour, take him for an enemy and kill him.
Unknown stalker. Unsavory reputation. No details available.
Unknown stalker. Unsavory reputation. No details available.
Guard from the Duty faction. If you are not their friend, stay away from them. No details available.
Stalker from the Duty faction. No details available.
Militant from the Duty faction. Usually well equipped. No details available.

A cad, bootlicker, hypocrite and coward. Barin's motto could well be, "After us, the Deluge". Takes advantage of any situation. Extremely ambitious and touchy. He came to the Zone, unsurprisingly, for money. For two years now he's been procuring material assets by all possible means.
Militant from the Duty faction. Usually well equipped. No details available.

Official recruiter for the Ukrainian Security Service. A frequent visitor of the bar. Everyone knows who he is, as well as the fact that he is the man to turn to when you fall on hard times. However, once you cross this line, there is no way back in the ranks of the honest stalkers.
A mobile scientific laboratory guard. No details available.
A scientific worker. No details available.

In everyday life a phlegmatic who keeps his emotions to himself and always stays cool. However, when under stress, he gets peppery and aggressive. Highly intellectual. A materialist regretting he had come to the Zone in the first place. After graduating from the medical university, was sent into the Zone where the scientists' camp needed a neurosurgeon assistant. Dissects mutant brains and researches their psychokinetic properties. Looking forward to his retirement when he can move back to the capital, as far as possible from this rotten place.
One of the stalkers who ran out of luck.
Unknown mercenary. Possibly well armed. No details available.
Unknown mercenary. Possibly well armed. No details available.
Unknown mercenary. Possibly well armed. No details available.
Unknown mercenary. Possibly well armed. No details available.
Stalker from the Monolith grouping. No details available.
Stalker from the Monolith grouping. No details available.
Stalker from the Monolith grouping. No details available.
Stalker from the Monolith grouping. No details available.
Military stalker. Well armed and highly dangerous. No details available.
Spetsnaz. Well equipped. No details available.

Stalker born under a lucky star. Many times, the teams he was with would end up in tight spots and every time he was the only survivor. Most stalkers stay away from him on account of the bad luck he is said to bring. Has been roaming the Zone on his own for quite some time now.
One of the veterans. Knows the Zone like the back of his hand. Usually well equipped and highly dangerous. No details available.

Experienced smuggler. For a long time, plied his trade in Africa and South America. The news of the Chernobyl disaster brought him to Ukraine. In a short while, he managed to smuggle hundreds of stuffed mutants out of the restricted area and earned the nickname "Taxidermist". When not "working" in the Zone, he is a successful trader. Loves fancy suits and posh ties, but prefers Soviet guns.

Took part in the war in Afghanistan. Formerly an atheist, but after surviving a Mujahideen ambush, he emerged a religious man. After the war in Afghanistan, he emigrated to Poland where he enrolled into a theological seminary. Having graduated from the seminary, he preached at the Catholic church in Lvov. After the explosion at the Chernobyl NPP, he volunteered to help the victims. In the last few years has been preaching in the Zone.

Formerly a mechanic at the "KholodMach" plant. After his wife left him, he decided to take his own life. However, being deeply religious, he chose the Zone as an unconventional suicide method. Contrary to his expectations, he survived. He has gained invaluable experience and has won the respect of other stalkers thanks to his professional skills. Master is probably the most qualified mechanic in the Zone, and repairs equipment and vehicles. Installing security systems in gang bunkers is what he does best. He is welcome everywhere he goes. A simple, stern man, a bit rough at times.

Former military stalker, lieutenant colonel in the Ministry of Interior troops. The only soldier to return from a disastrous operation deep in the Zone, later discovered that the mission was pointless and suicidal to begin with. That's when he decided not to come back, staged his own death and joined the stalkers. Quiet, cynical, firm of purpose.
Rookie. New to the Zone. No details available.

Klutz is 20 years old. He lost everything and everyone in the Big Land before deciding to come here. He barely makes a living in the Zone, but he simply has no other place to go to. Owes money to many stalkers. Frequents the Zone, but never goes there alone. Always trying to hang on to a group of experienced stalkers. Not a popular companion, as more often than not, he's plain useless. Hardly makes any money. Lives on doles from other stalkers and is deep in debt.
Veteran stalker. Possibly well equipped. No details available.
Veteran stalker. Possibly well equipped. No details available.

Oleg "the Fiend" Gusarov. A former "Black Beret", served in the Belotserkovskaya Spetsnaz brigade. Served multiple tours, became a master sergeant. A sniper and a bomb technician. A loner at heart, never ventures into the Zone in a group, preferring to act alone. He was offered to join the clans numerous times, but always refused.

A student from the Department of Physics who dropped out his senior year. He left for the Zone in search of easy money. Likes to show off his "scientific" knowledge and discourse on abstract philosophical issues. It's reason enough for other stalkers not to like him. Overall, a pretty decent fellow. A kind of idealist.

Sparrow is 27 years old, cunning, and farseeing, but also capable of the worst blunders. Can be mean. A rather dubious persona. A scrawny and pallid type. Came to the Zone out of curiosity, promising himself he would return home after two months. He never did. On his very first sally into the Zone, Sparrow managed to cross a field strewn with anomalies barehanded and clueless to how dangerous that was. As soon as he found out what he had done, he passed out. Since then, celebrates that date (October 9) as his second birthday.
Master of the Freedom faction. No details available.
Stalker from the Freedom faction. No details available.
Stalker from the Freedom faction. No details available.
Militant from the Freedom faction. Usually well equipped. No details available.

Leshiy, as his brother calls him, came to the Zone a young idealist. However, a few years of living a hairs breadth away from death, he turned him into a cynical realist. Considers the Zone his home, and thinks those who failed are unworthy to walk the face of the Earth.
Writes sketches and stories about the Zone under the name of Arkady. Former journalist. Meticulous and harsh, but fair. Widely respected by the stalkers.
One of the stalkers who ran out of luck.
One of the stalkers who ran out of luck.
One of the stalkers who ran out of luck.

A mysterious Stalker. He was found alive in the wreckage of a Death Truck, and as proof, he has a tattoo on his arm. Nobody knows where he came from, nor where he's going to. The only sure thing one can say about his is that he's suffering from amnesia, and that he wants to find his true self in the Zone.
Unknown stalker. Unsavory reputation. No details available.
Rookie. New to the Zone. No details available.
Bandit guard. Unsavory reputation. No details available.
Regular bandit. Unsavory reputation. No details available.
Rookie bandit. Unsavory reputation. No details available.
Experienced bandit. Unsavory reputation. No details available.
Bandit leader. Surprisingly, well educated and also known to have a degree.
Stalker from the Duty faction. No details available.
Stalker from the Monolith grouping. No details available.
Stalker from the Duty faction. No details available.
Stalker from the Duty faction. No details available.
Spetsnaz. Well equipped. No details available.
Rookie. New to the Zone. No details available.
Worker of X-16. No details available.
Unknown stalker. Unsavory reputation. No details available.
Veteran stalker. Usually helps to set up expeditions for Yantar scientific laboratory.
Employee of the Yantar scientific laboratory.
Employee of the Scientific laboratory on the lake Yantar.
Veteran researcher of the Zone. Participated in the first expeditions in 2007.
Research assistant at the mobile lab. No details available.
Unknown military personnel. Unofficially transports and guards scientific equipment.
Stalker trying to make his living.
Raven likes traveling to beautiful places in the zone, which are not constantly occupied by other Stalkers. He likes to look at the wildlife of the Zone from a safe distance.

Chezz is a veteran stalker who has spent years in the Zone. His time there has somewhat affected his social behavior, appearing quite strange to most others he meets. A major oddity of Chezz is how obsessed he is with the one and only weapon he carries named 'The Big Boy'.\n\nRumor has it, the very first day Chezz arrived to the zone a Whirligig Anomaly randomly blasted and suddenly the 'Big Boy' fell from the sky straight in-front of him. Ever since, Chezz claims this weapon to be a direct gift from the zone and believes he is alive to serve a great purpose. Furthermore, he believes his weapon to be an Artifact. Could this be true or just another crazy idea of his?

Alek was only a child when the partial core meltdown of the NPP happened at 3 mile island, in Pennsylvania on March 28th, 1979. His parents decided not to evacuate, even though they lived within close proximity to the NPP.Alek's father was a renowned scientist and he wanted to study the noble gases released into the atmosphere and the effects it may have on the surrounding vegetation and wild life. Once the Chernobyl incident happened in 1986, the US government sent Alek's family to the Ukraine so his father could assist in studying the effects of the noble gases there.\n\n Alek grew up in harsh environments and the zone was a natural place for him to continue his father's work. Alek spends his days gathering data from local vegetation and wild life, he stays clear of most people and confers with scientists when he comes across interesting data. Alek has also been known to horde rare artifacts, especially ones that negate the effect of radiation poising. Alek wants to travel into the deepest areas of the zone where the radiation poisoning is highest, so he can get pure readings and he needs the rarest artifacts to get the job done.

Boris the Shashlik King is on his eternal quest to deliver slav culture to the uneducated masses. Although coming into the Zone, where gopniks run around with submachine guns and everyone already squats and drinks vodka might seem as bringing wood to the forest...

Escaped to the Zone, sick and tired of everyday life in monetary slavery. Realizing zone's unique time bending properties, he decided to wait in the zone for the world outside to become a better place.
Leader of the Bar loner group.

A well-read stalker of swarthy complexion who apparently worked in Black Ops prior to entering the Zone. Sees himself as a gentleman. He gets on well with those sharing his ideological commitments but disdains regular stalkers. Claims he once worked with Ghost to take out the leader of Final Day.
